required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Oral Nitrite and Nitrate in Healthy Normal Volunteer Adults
clinical_study.official_title: An Open-Label Study of Oral Nitrite and Nitrate in Healthy Normal Volunteer Adults

brief_summary.textblock: This proposal hypothesizes that oral supplementation with sodium nitrite or nitrate will result in in vivo conversion of nitrate to nitrite and nitrite to nitric oxide with limited toxicity in the doses proposed in healthy adult normal volunteers. We utilize a powerful in vivo technique (pharmacokinetic testing) and are the first to design inorganic nitrate and nitrite capsules for cardiovascular disease.

detailed_description.textblock:
Preclinical and clinical research over the last decade has revealed the important vasoprotective effects of nitrates and nitrites with regards to reduction in blood pressure, vascular inflammation and endothelial dysfunction. New findings suggest an effect of nitrate and nitrite therapy in the regulation of glucose-insulin homeostasis. Development of an oral formulation of nitrate and nitrite salts is attractive, whereby nitrite would ensure rapid acting effects upon absorption, while the nitrate would continuously provide a slow formation of nitrite over a prolonged period of time via the enterosalivary circulation pathway.
For this reason, development of an oral formulation of nitrate and nitrite salts is attractive, whereby nitrite would ensure rapid acting effects upon absorption, while the nitrate would continuously provide a slow formation of nitrite over a prolonged period of time via the enterosalivary circulation pathway. This study aims to establish the pharmacokinetics, metabolism and interconversion of nitrate to nitrite and nitrite to nitric oxide in vivo in healthy adult normal volunteers.

primary_outcome.measure: Peak Plasma Nitrate Concentration Over 24 Hour Study Period
primary_outcome.description: "Post-doses" refers to that subjects will receive a single dose of each study drug, oral 15Nitrogen(15N)-labeled sodium nitrate and nitrite, in random order, separated by a 3-7 day washout period

primary_outcome.measure: Peak Plasma Nitrite Concentration Over 24 Hour Study Period
primary_outcome.description: "Post-doses" refers to that subjects will receive a single dose of each study drug, oral 15Nitrogen(15N)-labeled sodium nitrate and nitrite, in random order, separated by a 3-7 day washout period

primary_outcome.measure: Peak Red Blood Cell (RBC) Iron-nitrosyl Hemoglobin (NO-Hb) Concentrations Over 24 Hour Study Period
primary_outcome.description: "Post-doses" refers to that subjects will receive a single dose of each study drug, oral 15Nitrogen(15N)-labeled sodium nitrate and nitrite, in random order, separated by a 3-7 day washout period

secondary_outcome.measure: Peak Percentage Level of Methemoglobin Over 24 Hour Study Period
secondary_outcome.description: "Post-doses" refers to that subjects will receive a single dose of each study drug, oral 15N-labeled sodium nitrate and nitrite, in random order, separated by a 3-7 day washout period

secondary_outcome.measure: Peak Change in Mean Arterial Pressure Over 24 Hour Study Period
secondary_outcome.time_frame: measured at 0 (baseline) then every 15 minutes during the first 2 hours post-dose, then at 3, 6, and 24 hours post-dose, change at 0.75 hours reported
secondary_outcome.description: "Post-dose" refers to that subjects will receive a single dose of each study drug, oral 15N-labeled sodium nitrate and nitrite, in random order, separated by a 3-7 day washout period

secondary_outcome.measure: Peak Change in Systolic Blood Pressure Over 24 Hour Study Period
secondary_outcome.time_frame: measured at 0 (baseline) then every 15 minutes during the first 2 hours post-dose, then at 3, 6, and 24 hours post-dose, change at 1.5 hours reported
secondary_outcome.description: "Post-dose" refers to that subjects will receive a single dose of each study drug, oral 15N-labeled sodium nitrate and nitrite, in random order, separated by a 3-7 day washout period

secondary_outcome.measure: Peak Change in Diastolic Blood Pressure Over 24 Hour Study Period
secondary_outcome.time_frame: measured at 0 (baseline) then every 15 minutes during the first 2 hours post-dose, then at 3, 6, and 24 hours post-dose, change at 0.75 hours reported
secondary_outcome.description: "Post-dose" refers to that subjects will receive a single dose of each study drug, oral 15N-labeled sodium nitrate and nitrite, in random order, separated by a 3-7 day washout period

secondary_outcome.measure: Peak 15Nitrogen Nitro-conjugated Linoleic Acid (cLA) Concentrations Over 24 Hour Study Period
secondary_outcome.time_frame: measured at time 0 (trough), every 15 minutes during the first 2 hours post-dose, then at 3, 6, and 24 hours post-dose
secondary_outcome.description: "Post-dose" refers to that subjects will receive a single dose of each study drug, oral 15N-labeled sodium nitrate and nitrite, in random order, separated by a 3-7 day washout period

at timepoint with greatest change from 0 (trough); "Post-dose" refers to that subjects will receive a single dose of each study drug, oral 15N-labeled sodium nitrate and nitrite, in random order, separated by a 3-7 day washout period; percentage of platelets that express 2 specific markers identifying activated platelets (CD41 and CD62-P) were quantified using flow cytometry

secondary_outcome.measure: Peak Change in Heart Rate Over 24 Hour Study Period
secondary_outcome.time_frame: measured at 0 (baseline), every 15 minutes during the first 2 hours post-dose, then at 3, 6, and 24 hours post-dose, change at 1.5 hours for nitrate and 24 hours for nitrite
secondary_outcome.description: "Post-dose" refers to that subjects will receive a single dose of each study drug, oral 15N-labeled sodium nitrate and nitrite, in random order, separated by a 3-7 day washout period

clinical_study.condition: Focus of Study of Healthy Adults

arm_group.description: Oral sodium nitrate 1,000 mg once first, then washout followed by oral sodium nitrite 20 mg once
Oral sodium nitrite 20 mg once first, then washout followed by oral sodium nitrate 1,000 mg once

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age 18-60 years
- Systolic blood pressure ≤130 and diastolic blood pressure ≤85 mm Hg
Exclusion Criteria:
- Positive urine pregnancy test or breastfeeding
- Concurrent use of medications affecting glucose or lipid metabolism
- Recent addition or change in dosing of hormonal contraceptive medications (oral contraceptive pill, intrauterine device, DepoProvera)
- Current use of ≥2 anti-hypertensive agents regardless of blood pressure control or normotensive on a single agent
- Current use of phosphodiesterase 5 inhibitors or organic nitrates
- Not stable on treatments for the prior three months or not planning to remain on current dose of medications for blood pressure, contraception, etc
- Known chronic psychiatric or medical conditions including diabetes, liver or kidney disease or obesity syndromes
- Smoker

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Healthy adult participants were recruited between October 2012 and October 2013.

group.title: Oral 15N-labeled Sodium Nitrate, Then Sodium Nitrite
group.description: Oral 15N-labeled sodium nitrate 1,000 mg once in first intervention period and oral 15N-labeled sodium nitrite 20 mg once in second intervention period (after washout period)

group.title: Oral 15N-labeled Sodium Nitrite, Then Sodium Nitrate
group.description: Oral 15N-labeled sodium nitrite 20 mg once in first intervention period and oral 15N-labeled sodium nitrate 1,000 mg once in second intervention period (after washout period)

group.title: Entire Study Population
group.description: Includes groups randomized to received oral 15N-labeled sodium nitrate first and sodium nitrite first.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
